channel.title: books on अहो अहं
channel.description: Recent content in books on अहो अहं

item.title: Rework
item.description: by Jason Fried. Takedown Ignore the real world The real world isn’t a place, it’s an excuse. It’s a justification for not trying. It has nothing to do with you. Learning from mistakes is overrated Failure is not a prerequisite for success. People who failed have the same amount of success as people who have never tried at all. Long term business planing is fantasy. Start referring to any of your plans as guesses.

item.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
item.description: From Journeyman to Master Preface core process: taking a requirement and producing working, maintainable code that delights the user. QWAN - quality without a name. Don’t preach, just tell/do what works. pragmatic -> lat. (pragmaticus) -> greek “to do”. There are no easy answers There is no such thing as best solution, tool language or OS. You shouldn’t be weeded to any particular technology but have broad enough background and experience base to allow to choose good solution in any particular situation.

item.title: Testing Python
item.description: Chapter 1 Writing code without tests in general is going to lead to problems down the line. Choreographing One of the worst traps a developer can fall into is writing a bunch of code and then going back and testing it all at the end. With the advent of social networks and the ever-increasing pressure of media attention, defects in your code could be costly to both you and your reputation or that of any company you may represent.

item.title: Carlos Castaneda: 3. Cesta do Ixtlanu
item.description: 1 - Pritakanie sveta okolo nás nahnať strach synovi (dať mu lekciu) musí niekto iný ako otec, ktorý ho má ochraňovať (Iron John: kráľovi muži). od malička sa učíme popisu sveta, až si ho osvojíme a v ňom žijeme (matrix) a stratíme pojem o čare reality. rád hodne chodím. mentor: budeš mi platiť za môj čas tvojím časom. nikdy nič nepije, ani pivo. pre všetko, čo robíme, je nezbytná iba jedna vec - Duch!

item.title: Carlos Castaneda (1, 2)
item.description: Poznámky z prvých dvoch kníh od Carlosa Castanedu: 1. Učení Dona Juana … u nekonečne dlhej cesty sa nedá pokúsiť o nič viac, ako nájsť jej začiatok a stanoviť jej smer. Predstieranie, že cesta je pochopená a dokončená, je prinajmenšom klamaním samého seba. Jednotlivý študent na nej môže dosiahnuť dokonalosti iba v subjektívnom slova zmysle a vyprávať o nej môže iba tak, že povie všetko, čo bol schopný zhliadnuť. – Georg Simmel

item.title: The Greatest Escape - Adventures in the History of Solitude
item.description: Highlights from the book The Greatest Escape: Adventures in the History of Solitude (c) 2004 by David Stimpson - a kind of a Bible and eulogy on Solitude and Silence. Prologue life of solitude - either through periodic retreats or continuing inner solitude in society - may be the best answer to cries that modern world is inevitably a “lonely crowd.” your lonely quietude may be bothered by demons of lust, vainglory, or melancholy.
